snippet: Sloan-Kettering shows how a refusal to pay and public pressure can force a big drug company to bring down the cost of an overpriced cancer drug.
abstract: Editorial applauds doctors at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York for standing up to drugmaker Sanofi, which has lead to company reducing price on colorectal cancer drug Zaltrap; contends that it is heartening sign that physicians can play major role in helping to reduce escalating costs of health care for treatments of marginal value.
lead_paragraph: Sloan-Kettering shows how a refusal to pay and public pressure can force a big drug company to bring down the cost of an overpriced cancer drug.
